member.name: M:OdinSerializer.Utilities.TypeExtensions.GetEqualityComparerDelegate``1
member.summary:
Gets an equality comparer delegate used to compare the equality of values of a given type. In order, this will be:
1. The == operator, if one is defined on the type. 2. A delegate that uses , if the type implements that interface. 3. .NET's own

remarks.para: Note that in the special case of the type , a special equality comparer is returned that only checks whether all the Quaternion components are equal.

This is because, by default, Quaternion's equality operator is broken when operating on invalid quaternions; "default(Quaternion) == default(Quaternion)" evaluates to false, and this causes a multitude of problems.

member.summary: Determines whether a Unity object is null or "fake null", without ever calling Unity's own equality operators. This method is useful for checking if a Unity object is null, destroyed or missing at times when it is not allowed to call Unity's own equality operators, for example when not running on the main thread.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.UserTypes
member.summary: UserTypes includes all custom user scripts that are not located in an editor or plugin folder.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.PluginTypes
member.summary: PluginTypes includes all types located in the plugins folder and are not located in an editor folder.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.UnityTypes
member.summary: UnityTypes includes all types depended on UnityEngine and from UnityEngine, except editor, plugin and user types.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.UserEditorTypes
member.summary: UserEditorTypes includes all custom user scripts that are located in an editor folder but not in a plugins folder.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.PluginEditorTypes
member.summary: PluginEditorTypes includes all editor types located in the plugins folder.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.UnityEditorTypes
member.summary: UnityEditorTypes includes all editor types that are not user editor types nor plugin editor types.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.OtherTypes
member.summary: OtherTypes includes all other types that are not depended on UnityEngine or UnityEditor.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.CustomTypes
member.summary: CustomTypes includes includes all types manually added to the Unity project. This includes UserTypes, UserEditorTypes, PluginTypes and PluginEditorTypes.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.GameTypes
member.summary: GameTypes includes all assemblies that are likely to be included in builds. This includes UserTypes, PluginTypes, UnityTypes and OtherTypes.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.EditorTypes
member.summary: EditorTypes includes UserEditorTypes, PluginEditorTypes and UnityEditorTypes.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.Utilities.AssemblyTypeFlags.All
member.summary: All includes UserTypes, PluginTypes, UnityTypes, UserEditorTypes, PluginEditorTypes, UnityEditorTypes and OtherTypes.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.Utilities.MemberAliasMethodInfo

Provides a methods of representing aliased methods.
In this case, what we're representing is a method on a parent class with the same name.
We aggregate the MethodInfo associated with this member and return a mangled form of the name. The name that we return is "parentname+methodName".

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.Utilities.MemberAliasMethodInfo.Invoke(System.Object,System.Reflection.BindingFlags,System.Reflection.Binder,System.Object[],System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, invokes the reflected method or constructor with the given parameters.
member.param: The object on which to invoke the method or constructor. If a method is static, this argument is ignored. If a constructor is static, this argument must be null or an instance of the class that defines the constructor.
A bitmask that is a combination of 0 or more bit flags from . If is null, this parameter is assigned the value ; thus, whatever you pass in is ignored.
An object that enables the binding, coercion of argument types, invocation of members, and retrieval of MemberInfo objects via reflection. If is null, the default binder is used.

An argument list for the invoked method or constructor. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, this should be null.If the method or constructor represented by this instance takes a ByRef parameter, there is no special attribute required for that parameter in order to invoke the method or constructor using this function. Any object in this array that is not explicitly initialized with a value will contain the default value for that object type. For reference-type elements, this value is null. For value-type elements, this value is 0, 0.0, or false, depending on the specific element type.

An instance of CultureInfo used to govern the coercion of types. If this is null, the CultureInfo for the current thread is used. (This is necessary to convert a String that represents 1000 to a Double value, for example, since 1000 is represented differently by different cultures.)
member.returns: An Object containing the return value of the invoked method, or null in the case of a constructor, or null if the method's return type is void. Before calling the method or constructor, Invoke checks to see if the user has access permission and verifies that the parameters are valid.CautionElements of the array that represent parameters declared with the ref or out keyword may also be modified.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.DataFormat
member.summary: Specifies a data format to read and write in.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.DataFormat.Binary
member.summary: A custom packed binary format. This format is most efficient and almost allocation-free, but its serialized data is not human-readable.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.DataFormat.JSON
member.summary:
A JSON format compliant with the json specification found at "http://www.json.org/".
This format has rather sluggish performance and allocates frightening amounts of string garbage.

member.name: F:OdinSerializer.DataFormat.Nodes
member.summary:
A format that does not serialize to a byte stream, but to a list of data nodes in memory which can then be serialized by Unity.
This format is highly inefficient, and is primarily used for ensuring that Unity assets are mergeable by individual values when saved in Unity's text format. This makes serialized values more robust and data recovery easier in case of issues.
This format is *not* recommended for use in builds.

Provides a set of methods for reading data stored in a format written by a corresponding class.
If you implement this interface, it is VERY IMPORTANT that you implement each method to the *exact* specifications the documentation specifies.
It is strongly recommended to inherit from the class if you wish to implement a new data reader.

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.IDataReader.EnterNode(System.Type@)
member.summary:
Tries to enter a node. This will succeed if the next entry is an .
This call MUST (eventually) be followed by a corresponding call to
This call will change the values of the , , and properties to the correct values for the current node.
member.param: The type of the node. This value will be null if there was no metadata, or if the reader's serialization binder failed to resolve the type name.
member.returns: true if entering a node succeeded, otherwise false

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.IDataReader.ExitNode
member.summary:
Exits the current node. This method will keep skipping entries using until an is reached, or the end of the stream is reached.
This call MUST have been preceded by a corresponding call to .
This call will change the values of the , , and to the correct values for the node that was prior to the current node.
member.returns: true if the method exited a node, false if it reached the end of the stream.

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.IDataReader.ExitArray
member.summary:

member.returns: true if the method exited an array, false if it reached the end of the stream.

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.JsonDataReader.EnterNode(System.Type@)
member.summary:
Tries to enter a node. This will succeed if the next entry is an .
This call MUST (eventually) be followed by a corresponding call to
This call will change the values of the , , and properties to the correct values for the current node.
member.param: The type of the node. This value will be null if there was no metadata, or if the reader's serialization binder failed to resolve the type name.
member.returns: true if entering a node succeeded, otherwise false

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.JsonDataReader.ExitNode
member.summary:
Exits the current node. This method will keep skipping entries using until an is reached, or the end of the stream is reached.
This call MUST have been preceded by a corresponding call to .
This call will change the values of the , , and to the correct values for the node that was prior to the current node.
member.returns: true if the method exited a node, false if it reached the end of the stream.

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.JsonDataReader.EnterArray(System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Tries to enters an array node. This will succeed if the next entry is an .
This call MUST (eventually) be followed by a corresponding call to
This call will change the values of the , , and properties to the correct values for the current array node.
member.param: The length of the array that was entered.
member.returns: true if an array was entered, otherwise false

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.JsonDataReader.ExitArray
member.summary:
Exits the closest array. This method will keep skipping entries using until an is reached, or the end of the stream is reached.
This call MUST have been preceded by a corresponding call to .
This call will change the values of the , , and to the correct values for the node that was prior to the exited array node.
member.returns: true if the method exited an array, false if it reached the end of the stream.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.AlwaysFormatsSelfAttribute
member.summary:
Use this attribute to specify that a type that implements the interface should *always* format itself regardless of other formatters being specified.
This means that the interface will be used to format all types derived from the type that is decorated with this attribute, regardless of custom formatters for the derived types.

member.summary: The priority of the formatter. Of all the available custom formatters, the formatter with the highest priority is always chosen.

member.param: The priority of the formatter. Of all the available custom formatters, the formatter with the highest priority is always chosen.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.CustomGenericFormatterAttribute
member.summary:
Attribute indicating that a generic type definition class which implements the interface somewhere in its hierarchy is a custom formatter for *any variation* of the generic type definition T.
The formatter's generic type parameters are mapped onto the serialized type's generic type parameters.
For example, implements , where T is .

member.exception: The type given in is not a generic type definition.

summary.para: Causes Odin's inspector to completely ignore a given member, preventing it from even being included in an Odin PropertyTree, and such will not cause any performance hits in the inspector.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.ISelfFormatter
member.summary:
Specifies that a type is capable of serializing itself using an and an .
The deserialized type instance will be created without a constructor call using the
method if it is a reference type, otherwise it will be created using default(type).
Use to specify that a class which implements this interface should *always* format itself regardless of other formatters being specified.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.SerializationPolicies
member.summary:
Contains a set of default implementations of the interface.
NOTE: Policies are not necessarily compatible with each other in intuitive ways. Data serialized with the policy will for example fail to deserialize auto-properties with , even if only strict data is needed. It is best to ensure that you always use the same policy for serialization and deserialization.
This class and all of its policies are thread-safe.

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.SerializationPolicies.TryGetByID(System.String,OdinSerializer.ISerializationPolicy@)
member.summary: Tries to get a serialization policy by its id, in case a serialization graph has the policy used for serialization stored by name.

member.name: P:OdinSerializer.SerializationPolicies.Everything
member.summary: All fields not marked with are serialized. If a field is marked with both and , then the field will be serialized.

member.name: P:OdinSerializer.SerializationPolicies.Unity
member.summary:
Public fields and fields or auto-properties marked with or and not marked with are serialized.
There are two exceptions: all fields in tuples, as well as in private nested types marked as compiler generated (e.g. lambda capture classes) are also serialized.

member.name: P:OdinSerializer.SerializationPolicies.Strict
member.summary:
Only fields and auto-properties marked with or and not marked with are serialized.
There is one exception: all fields in private nested types marked as compiler generated (e.g. lambda capture classes) are also serialized.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.Serializer
member.summary:
Serializes and deserializes a given type, and wraps serialization and deserialization with all the proper calls to free formatters from tedious boilerplate.
Whenever serializing or deserializing anything, it is *strongly recommended* to use to get a proper wrapping serializer for that type.
NOTE: This class should NOT be inherited from; it is hard-coded into the system.
To extend the serialization system, instead create custom formatters, which are used by the class.

member.summary: Editor-only event that fires whenever a serializer serializes a type.

summary.para: Custom formatter for the type. This serializes nothing and always deserializes null, and only exists to ensure that no coroutine instances are ever created by the serialization system, since they will in almost all cases be invalid instances.
Invalid coroutine instances crash Unity instantly when they are garbage collected.

This event is invoked before everything else when a formatter is being resolved for a given type. If any invoked delegate returns a valid formatter, that formatter is used and the resolve process stops there.
This can be used to hook into and extend the serialization system's formatter resolution logic.

member.name: M:OdinSerializer.SerializationUtility.CreateCopy(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of an object. Returns null if null. All Unity objects references will remain the same - they will not get copied.

member.name: T:OdinSerializer.UnitySerializationUtility
member.summary:
Provides an array of utility wrapper methods for easy serialization and deserialization of Unity objects of any type.
Note that setting the IndexReferenceResolver on contexts passed into methods on this class will have no effect, as it will always be set to a UnityReferenceResolver.
